Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
MISHAP
Early system on IBM 1103 or 1103A. Listed in CACM 2(5):16, (May 1959).

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Mishap \Mis*hap"\, v. i. To happen unluckily; -- used impersonally. [Obs.] ``If that me mishap.'' --Chaucer. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Mishap \Mis*hap"\, n. Evil accident; ill luck; misfortune; mischance. --Chaucer. [1913 Webster]
Secure from worldly chances and mishaps. --Shak. [1913 Webster]

mishap n 1: an unpredictable outcome that is unfortunate; "if I didn't have bad luck I wouldn't have any luck at all" [syn: {bad luck}, {mischance}] 2: an instance of misfortune [syn: {misadventure}, {mischance}]
